intro: Mapania pallescens, commonly known as the pale mapania, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, pale green leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
